page.description: Used in a Web application to save data to the Web Application Repository.
page.syntax: L Result = a5w_SaveToWebAppRepository(C key ,C Data [,C objectType [,C componentGuid [,C userId [,C securityGroups [,* pResultIn ]]]]])

argument.name: key
argument.description: Key value of the data you are saving. This is how data is retrieved from the repository. Must be a unique value. Limit 100 characters.

argument.name: Data
argument.description: The data to save in the repository. Must be character data. No length limit

argument.name: objectType
argument.description: (optional) A description of the type of data; the description can be determined by the user. Limit 40 characters.

argument.name: componentGuid
argument.description: (optional) The GUID of the component from where the data was saved. Limit 40 characters.

argument.name: userId
argument.description: (optional) The userId of the user who saved the data in the repository. Limit 40 characters.

argument.name: securityGroups
argument.description: (optional) The security groups that are allowed to retrieve the data.

argument.name: pResultIn
argument.description: An object that contains the following properites:

item.name: hasError
item.description: A .t./.f. value. If hasError is .t., then an error occured. *[xb:errorText]* will contain additional information about the error.

page.example:
? a5w_SaveToWebAppRepository("name","Jane Smith") = .T.
dim pResult as p ? a5w_GetFromWebAppRepository("name", pResult) = "Jane Smith"
? pResult = errorText = "" hasError = .F.
page.discussion: Used in a Web application to save data to the Web Application Repository. Returns .t. if the data was saved, or .f. if it was not saved. The Web Application Repository is a table in a database (SQL or DBF) where the web application can read or write data - such as email templates or saved queries. See [Web Application Repository] for more information.
